channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hoxton Beach street food. Illegal stall?, 17th July
item.description:
Hoxton Beach street food sellers has opened at the corner of Melcombe and Baker Street. It's selling take away food, as a result the pigeon's and seagulls have increased in the area. Pigeons can be seen waiting on the windowsills of 219 Baker Street, for food to be dropped. Has the seller got a licence to be there? Previously the stand was allocated to a flower seller, which was much better for the area. If it is illegal (ie no licence) could it be closed down please, if it's legal could the licence be reevaluated. Selling street food in an area with a pigeon problem is only going to make the issue worse. This doesn't feel right for a residential area and will encourage vermin.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 134, Marylebone Road, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerbstone was sticking out in the road, 17th July
item.description:
I was driving towards Sidcup Hill via the width restriction (near Baugh Road). The kerb had been hit and was protruding into the road, this ripped through my tyre. I subsequently drove directly to a tyre garage (SE Tyres) in Cray Road. The tyre had a hole, as result of the obstruction on the road. Cost £300 for a replacement, the trye was 2 months old. The garage explained I was not the first car this had happened to. I took pictures the next day, as you can see the obstruction had been moved to the centre of the island.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baugh Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Asbestos water tank and various bits of junk left on the path, 17th July
item.description:
There has been an asbestos water tank and various bits of junk left on the path by the wall opposite the Hazlebabk allotment on the south end of the street, near Hazelbank. The asbestos is broken and in a bad state of repair and is uncovered and exposed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hafton Road, Catford South, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing Bins in Street, 17th July
item.description:
These bins have been overflowing for several weeks now, spilling out rubbish on to the pavement. It needs removing and keeping clear. It will encourage rats and vermin and people will walk through it. It looks awful too. This is located at the start of Blanmerle Path which runs from Blanmerle Road to New Eltham station. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Blanmerle Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
